html:
3.21.18  9:01 am   "diminished" gets brought up only when discussing chords and intervals it seems, "flat" is a modifier to a note and nothing more. however, diminishing an interval means making one note flat, that's why it gets so confusing.

when we say Cdim we mean C/Eb/Gb. When we say Cdim7 is the seventh also diminished (C/Eb/Gb/Bbb=A)?

     If yes, what do we call C/Eb/Gb/Bb?

      And what about a major seventh in an otherwise diminished C/Eb/Gb/B?
original_html:
3.21.18  9:01 am   "diminished" gets brought up only when discussing chords and intervals it seems, "flat" is a modifier to a note and nothing more. however, diminishing an interval means making one note flat, that's why it gets so confusing.

when we say Cdim we mean C/Eb/Gb. When we say Cdim7 is the seventh also diminished (C/Eb/Gb/Bbb=A)?

      And what about a major seventh in an otherwise diminished C/Eb/Gb/B?
